description.narrative: - The Project will significantly demonstrate how domestic companies use their strong comparative advantages of low cost of production and scale to exploit the opportunities that enable them to move up the pharmaceutical value chain in selling to more regulated markets. - The Project will support the Company's expansion enabling wider availability of high quality, low cost drugs in developed and developing markets.

Granules India Limited (Granules or the Company) an existing IFC client is a leading Contract Manufacturing Organization supplying high volume Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients, Pharmaceutical Formulation Intermediates (PFIs) and finished formulations to the bulk over-the-counter drugs industry in the US, Europe, Latin America, Australia and India. Granules has three wholly-owned manufacturing plants near Hyderabad in India (Jeedimetla, Bonthapally, and Gagillapur) and one plant in China through a 50:50 joint venture.
The company is undertaking an investment program (the Project) estimated to cost about $22 million, comprising of: expanding the capacity of its multi-product tableting plant, expanding the capacity of its PFI plant and expanding its warehousing capacity.
